response.answer_text: “Money” was also an early Motown song sung by Barrett Strong in 1959. The Beatles covered it! Everyone calls it just “Money”, but technically it’s called “Money (That’s What I What). The “that’s what I want” part is sung as a refrain by the Beatles in between vocalizations of the lead singer who was John Lennon. Their producer George Martin played piano on the song. The song with Barrett Strong was not the very first on Motown’s label, but it put Motown on the map: It was Motown’s first real hit. The song was written by Tamla/Motown founder Barry Gordy with the help of Janie Bradford. Barrett Strong’s version (the original “Money”, which has been covered many times) came out in 1959 but did not hit big until 1960.
i believe it is either Cardi B or Pink Floyd you are thinking about. Cardi B - Money [Official Music Video] Money - Pink Floyd HD (Studio Version)
